page.title: 13OLDER RESIDENTS REMEMBER 1
page.content: Three senior citizens were interviewed - Mrs Graham (97), Miss Vassie (88), and Mr McMartin (76). All 3 remembered how the town had burst beyond its 19th Century boundaries, expanding south-east into Ashfield and westwards into Summerfield, Belhaven Road and the 'Tree Scheme'. The High Street has remained comparatively unchanged but the Harbour area (scene of overcrowding in the 1920's) has been largely rebuilt. The two ladies noted that though the town had expanded, the social life had contracted - Dunbar was a garrison town between the Wars and had a lively social life - military parades and bands, concerts of a high standard, Pierrot shows in the Pavilion, Silent Movies in the 'Dreadnought' by the Harbour. (continued on next page)
